sentences.sentence: Sleeping Beauty
A long time ago there were a King and Queen who wished for a long time for a child, but without success.
But then, one time when the Queen was bathing( 沐浴 ), a frog( 青蛙 ) crept( 爬 ) out of the water on to the land, and said to her,
“Your wish shall come true. Before a year has gone by, you shall have a daughter.”
What the frog had said came true, and the Queen had a beautiful little girl.
The King was so happy that he gave a great feast( 宴会 ).
He invited not only his friends( 朋友 ) and relations, but also the Wise Women( 女巫 ), in order that they might bless( 赐福 ) the child.
There were thirteen of them in his kingdom, but, as he had only twelve golden plates( 盘子 ) for them to eat out of, one of them had to stay home.
It was a splendid( 盛大的 ) feast, and when it came to an end the Wise Women gave their magic gifts to the baby.
One gave virtue( 美德 ), another beauty, a third riches, and so on with everything in the world that one can wish for.
When eleven of them had given their gifts, suddenly the thirteenth came in.
She was angry that she had not been invited, and without greeting( 问候 ), or even looking at any one,
she cried with a loud voice, “The King’s daughter shall, in her fifteenth year, prick herself with a spindle, and fall down dead.”
And, without saying a word more, she turned round and left the room.
They were all shocked( 吃惊的 ); but the twelfth, whose good wish still remained unspoken, came forward.
She could not undo( 消除 ) the evil( 邪恶的 ) wish, but only soften it.
So she said, “The princess( 公主 ) shall not die, but only fall into a death-like for a hundred years.”
The King, who would do anything to protect his dear child, gave orders that every spindle( 纺锤 ) in the whole kingdom should be burnt.
Meanwhile( 与此同时 ) all the other Wise Women’s wishes came true.
The Princess was so beautiful, modest( 谦虚的 ), good-natured, and wise, that everyone who saw her loved her.
On her fifteenth birthday, the King and Queen were not at home, and the girl was left in the palace quite alone.
So she went round into all sorts of places looking into rooms just as she liked, and at last came to an old tower.
She climbed up the narrow( 狭窄的 ) staircase( 楼梯 ), and reached a little door.
A rusty( 生锈的 ) key was in the lock, and when she turned it the door sprang open( 反弹开 ), and there in a little room sat an old woman with a spindle, busily spinning thread( 纺线 ).
“Good day, old woman,” said the King’s daughter. “What are you doing there?”
“I am spinning( 纺线 ),” said the old woman, and nodded her head.
“What sort of thing is that, that turns round and round so fast?” said the girl.
She took the spindle, and wanted to spin( 纺线 ) too.
But as soon as she touched it, the power of the magic caused her to prick( 扎 ) her finger with it.
And, in the very moment when she felt it, she fell down upon the bed that stood there, and lay in a deep sleep.
This sleep spread over the whole palace.
The King and Queen, who had just come home, and had entered the great hall, began to go to sleep, and the whole of the court with them.
The horses, too, went to sleep in the stable( 马厩 ), the dogs in the yard, the pigeons( 鸽子 ) upon the roof( 房顶 ), the flies on the wall;
even the fire that was flaming( 燃烧 ) on the hearth( 壁炉 ) became quiet and slept,
the roast meat( 烤肉 ) stopped roasting( 烘，烤 ),
and the cook, who was just going to pull the hair of the kitchen boy because he had forgotten something, let him go, and went to sleep.
And the wind fell, and on the trees around the castle( 城堡 ) not a leaf moved again.
But round about the castle there began to grow a hedge( 灌木丛 ) of thorns( 带刺的灌木 ), which every year became higher, and at last grew up closely around the castle and all over it.
Soon nothing of the castle could be seen, not even the flag upon the roof.
But the story of the beautiful sleeping “Briar Rose,” for so the princess was named, went about the country,
so that from time to time kings’ sons came and tried to get through the thorny( 带刺的 ) hedge into the castle.
But they found it impossible, for the thorns clung( 紧挨着 ) together, as if they had hands, and the youths were caught in them, could not get free again, and died a miserable( 痛苦的 ) death.

question.cn: 为什么第十三个女巫生气了？
question.en: Why was the thirteenth Wise Women angry?

options.cn: 因为她没被邀请参加宴会。
options.en: Because she was not invited to the feast.

options.cn: 因为她生病了不能来参加宴会。
options.en: Because she was too sick to come to the feast.

analysis: 文中提到：“She was angry that she had not been invited.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: 当睡美人陷入沉睡时，多大了？
question.en: How old was “Sleeping Beauty” when she fell into a deep sleep?

analysis: 由原文可知，在“睡美人”十五岁的时候，国王和王后外出，她一个人去外面玩儿，碰到了施咒的女巫，陷入沉睡，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 当“睡美人”陷入沉睡后，整个王宫发生了什么？
question.en: What happened to the whole palace after Sleeping Beauty went into a deep sleep?

options.cn: 整个王宫都被洪水淹没了。

options.en: The whole palace also lay in a deep sleep.

analysis: 文中提到：“And, in the very moment when she felt it, she fell down upon the bed that stood there, and lay in a deep sleep. This sleep spread over the whole palace.”因此答案选C。
